content:
Diagnosis:	T2N1M0 p16 positive oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radical chemoradiotherapy. He completed treatment on 15/3/24 with good compliance throughout, managing all planned cycles of weekly cisplatin and the full course of radiotherapy.?
?
He is recovering well from the acute effects of treatment. His swallowing has significantly improved and he is now managing a soft diet without requiring supplementary feeding. The grade 2 radiation-induced skin reaction has largely resolved. He continues to have mild xerostomia but this is gradually improving with regular oral rinses.?
?
On examination today, there is complete resolution of the original tumor at the right base of tongue. The previously involved right level 2 lymph nodes are no longer palpable. His weight has stabilised at 72kg.?
?
The plan is for surveilance imaging with a contrast-enhanced CT neck/thorax in 8 weeks time. We will see him back in clinic with these results. I have provided him with contact details for the head and neck specialist nurse should he have any concerns in the interim.
